revised_title: Investigating Blaze Currents and Their Relation to Vitality in Tissues
tldr: The author investigates the response of the eyeball and other frog organs to single induction shocks, examining the relationship between blaze currents and tissue vitality. The study finds that the capillary electrometer provides more accurate results than the galvanometer and that the response to light stimulation is minimal in the capillary electrometer.
